page.title: 01MARSDEN.
page.content: MARSDEN. This area is mainly coastal grassland.It lies between the ports of South Shields and Sunderland,on the north-east coast of England,in the Metropolitan County of Tyne and Wear. One of the main features is a famous bird sanctuary, a limestone stack known as Marsden Rock. To the south of the rock is Souter Lighthouse which stands on Lizard Point. To the west of the lighthouse across the adjacent A183 is Marsden Quarry. The area also includes a golf_course,a riding school and a caravan site.
